title: How to Make eBay Purchases

steps.headline: Enter keyword(s) in search box.
steps.description: Use multiple keywords to help reduce the number of unintended results found. Multiple keywords may hinder chances of finding the item if seller used different keywords in the listing title.

steps.headline: Select a category.
steps.description: If you are uncertain which category to choose leave this set to its default (All Categories). Click on 'Search' once a category has been chosen. If no results are found for your keywords eBay will likely suggest keywords to use. If you decide to use eBay's new keywords, click on the new keywords to redirect to a new results page. If eBay's suggestions don't match what you're looking for make change the keywords and search again.

steps.headline: Browse through the search results.
steps.description: Click any title of an item to be redirected to the item's page. If the item wasn't found determine if: the search needs refining, or if the keywords were too specific. If it is necessary to refine the search (i.e. too many results were found) you can use the side bar to refine the search criteria: Categories; Price: Min-Max; Seller

steps.headline: Click on 'Categories' on the top menu bar, this will redirect you to the 'Category' webpage.
Select a category.
steps.description: Click on 'More' at the bottom of each sub-category list to see more sub-categories.

steps.headline: Once you have search through search results and found the item you would like to purchase, its time to make some final considerations and begin bidding to buy the item.
Consider the seller of the item.
Check that you can/are willing to use the method of payment specified by the seller.
Review the product description, shipping details, payment instructions, and return policy.
steps.description: If any of these details might change your mind on bidding, go back to searching for a different listing.

steps.headline: Send the seller a question (or questions) regarding the item.
steps.description: By asking questions you have a chance to get to know the seller prior to the transaction. The response time and the quality of the response is a good gauge of how the sale will go. Ask the seller any questions regarding the item or the seller's policies.

steps.headline: Decide whether to bid or 'Buy It Now.'
steps.description: The 'Buy It Now' option will skip the bidding process and purchase the item for the specified price. Once bidding has started on an item the 'Buy It Now' option will become unavailable. Consider the time left on the auction when deciding whether to bid or 'Buy It Now.' If an item has just a little time until auction close you will probably win the item cheaper through bidding.

steps.headline: Buy the item.
steps.description: Click on 'Buy It Now.'

steps.headline: Confirm the purchase on the following page.
Calculate your maximum bid; be sure to include shipping costs in this equation.
steps.description: eBay allows for you to enter your maximum bid, which eBay will use that bid as a proxy bid (Proxy bidding means that eBay will increase your bid as other eBay users bid on the item until your maximum bid is reached).

steps.headline: Enter the maximum bid.
steps.description: Once you have entered your maximum bid click on 'Place Bid.'

steps.headline: Confirm the maximum bid.
steps.description: Before confirming check that the number you entered is correct, misplacing a decimal point could be a costly mistake. Once you click on 'Confirm Bid' you have entered into a binding agreement to purchase the item if you win the auction. After clicking 'Confirm Bid' you may receive notice that you have been outbid (this happens immediately through eBay's proxy bidding), if this happens return to step 1 and recalculate your maximum bid.

steps.headline: If you are the current high bidder, re-evaluate your maximum bid.
steps.description: Through proxy bidding your bid may be dangerously close to the maximum bid you entered, if this is the case it is time to re-evaluate your maximum bid.

steps.headline: Monitor the item.
steps.description: eBay provides the option of receiving outbid notices through email or SMS. Watching the item during the final moments of bidding will ensure that you can be the high bidder and win the auction.

steps.headline: Select method of payment.
steps.description:
PayPal
Credit card

Money order/ cashier's check
Personal check

steps.headline: Enter the shipping address.
steps.description: eBay will automatically choose the default shipping address, but allows options to add a new address or to change to a shipping address previously used.

steps.headline: Enter PayPal information on the eBay payment page.
steps.description: This will automatically transfer the payment details to PayPal.

steps.headline: Verify that all information regarding shipment and payment is correct.
Purchase money order or cashier's check.
steps.description: These can be purchases at banks, the Post Office, grocery stores and convenience stores.

steps.headline: Notify seller of payment made through eBay's messaging service
Write the check.
steps.description: Ensure the seller's name and the monetary amount is correct. Photocopy the check and file the copy.

steps.headline: Mail the check.
steps.description: Check that seller and return address are correct.

steps.headline: Notify seller of payment made through eBay's messaging service.
Click on 'My eBay'.
steps.description: My eBay link located at the top right corner of any eBay page.

steps.headline: Select transaction(s) on which to leave feedback.
steps.description: EBAY allows you to leave feedback for multiple transactions at a time.

steps.headline: Rate the transaction.
steps.description:
Positive: Will add one point to the seller's rating. Neutral: Will not affect the seller's rating
Negative: Will subtract one point from the seller's rating

steps.headline: Create an explanation of the rating.
steps.description: Describe what was good or bad about the transaction.

steps.headline: Rate the details of the transaction.
steps.description: Select the star that correlates to each question. Detailed seller ratings are anonymous.

steps.headline: Click on 'Leave Feedback' to submit the feedback.

text:
Keyword Search Enter keyword(s) in search box. Use multiple keywords to help reduce the number of unintended results found. Multiple keywords may hinder chances of finding the item if seller used different keywords in the listing title. Select a category. If you are uncertain which category to choose leave this set to its default (All Categories). Click on 'Search' once a category has been chosen. If no results are found for your keywords eBay will likely suggest keywords to use. If you decide to use eBay's new keywords, click on the new keywords to redirect to a new results page. If eBay's suggestions don't match what you're looking for make change the keywords and search again. Browse through the search results. Click any title of an item to be redirected to the item's page. If the item wasn't found determine if: the search needs refining, or if the keywords were too specific. If it is necessary to refine the search (i.e. too many results were found) you can use the side bar to refine the search criteria: Categories; Price: Min-Max; Seller Category Search Click on 'Categories' on the top menu bar, this will redirect you to the 'Category' webpage.  Select a category. Click on 'More' at the bottom of each sub-category list to see more sub-categories. Select a subcategory.  Search through the results page.  Buy an item Once you have search through search results and found the item you would like to purchase, its time to make some final considerations and begin bidding to buy the item.  Consider the seller of the item.  Check that you can/are willing to use the method of payment specified by the seller.  Review the product description, shipping details, payment instructions, and return policy. If any of these details might change your mind on bidding, go back to searching for a different listing. Send the seller a question (or questions) regarding the item. By asking questions you have a chance to get to know the seller prior to the transaction. The response time and the quality of the response is a good gauge of how the sale will go. Ask the seller any questions regarding the item or the seller's policies. Decide whether to bid or 'Buy It Now.' The 'Buy It Now' option will skip the bidding process and purchase the item for the specified price. Once bidding has started on an item the 'Buy It Now' option will become unavailable. Consider the time left on the auction when deciding whether to bid or 'Buy It Now.' If an item has just a little time until auction close you will probably win the item cheaper through bidding. 'Buy It Now' Buy the item. Click on 'Buy It Now.' Confirm the purchase on the following page.  Bid on an item Calculate your maximum bid; be sure to include shipping costs in this equation. eBay allows for you to enter your maximum bid, which eBay will use that bid as a proxy bid (Proxy bidding means that eBay will increase your bid as other eBay users bid on the item until your maximum bid is reached). Enter the maximum bid. Once you have entered your maximum bid click on 'Place Bid.' Confirm the maximum bid. Before confirming check that the number you entered is correct, misplacing a decimal point could be a costly mistake. Once you click on 'Confirm Bid' you have entered into a binding agreement to purchase the item if you win the auction. After clicking 'Confirm Bid' you may receive notice that you have been outbid (this happens immediately through eBay's proxy bidding), if this happens return to step 1 and recalculate your maximum bid. If you are the current high bidder, re-evaluate your maximum bid. Through proxy bidding your bid may be dangerously close to the maximum bid you entered, if this is the case it is time to re-evaluate your maximum bid. Monitor the item. eBay provides the option of receiving outbid notices through email or SMS. Watching the item during the final moments of bidding will ensure that you can be the high bidder and win the auction. Pay for an item Click on 'Pay Now.'  Select method of payment. PayPal
Credit card

Money order/ cashier's check
Personal check Enter the shipping address. eBay will automatically choose the default shipping address, but allows options to add a new address or to change to a shipping address previously used. Enter your credit card information.  Confirm payment.  Enter PayPal information on the eBay payment page. This will automatically transfer the payment details to PayPal. Verify that all information regarding shipment and payment is correct.  Verify shipping address.  Make payment.  Purchase money order or cashier's check. These can be purchases at banks, the Post Office, grocery stores and convenience stores. Notify seller of payment made through eBay's messaging service  Mark payment made on 'My eBay.'  Write the check. Ensure the seller's name and the monetary amount is correct. Photocopy the check and file the copy. Mail the check. Check that seller and return address are correct. Notify seller of payment made through eBay's messaging service.  Mark payment made on 'My eBay.'  Monitor email for shipping notification.  Leave feedback Click on 'My eBay'. My eBay link located at the top right corner of any eBay page. Click on 'Leave Feedback'.  Select transaction(s) on which to leave feedback. EBAY allows you to leave feedback for multiple transactions at a time. Rate the transaction. Positive: Will add one point to the seller's rating. Neutral: Will not affect the seller's rating
Negative: Will subtract one point from the seller's rating Create an explanation of the rating. Describe what was good or bad about the transaction. Rate the details of the transaction. Select the star that correlates to each question. Detailed seller ratings are anonymous. Click on 'Leave Feedback' to submit the feedback.
